Policy circular no 11041/21/2002lAdmn.III dated February, 2004 has been issued as guideline for tax at source on payments to consultants, contractors and expatriate staff of the consultants. Para B of the above circutar deals with the payments to foreign and Jocal consuitant where the foreign consultants in agsociation with the locaf consultants enter with an agreement with NHAI fcr consultancy work Following are tne types of the contract generally entered into: 1} Contracts entered into with a Joint Venture (J.V.) of the foreign consultant and Iocal consultants Contracts entered with an association of foreign and local consultants It has been observed in number of cases that the terms of payment among the consultant are not properly defined and in some cases one of the consultants ask for the payment of the whole contract sum As the contracts are concluded with the JV or the association of consultants the payment should either be made to the Joint Venture or to the individual consultant based on Ihe share of input duly   supported by fhe Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) entered in to by the consultants_ As the taxTDS rate for the foreign and Jocal consultants are different; to ensure proper tax compliance following procedure may be followed: Total Payments inclusive of local and foreign currency component should eilher be made to the Joint Venture and a separate bank account of the Joint Venture should be opened. Joint Venture should obtain PAN from the income tax department, which should be submitted before   the payment: Obtaining of PAN is obligatory as per Income Tax Act: OR In the case of payment is required to be made to the individual consultant, the same should be specifically defined in the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) and share of payment may be quantified in the MoU. Share of payment defined in the MoU should be in conformity with the cost estimate submitted by the consultant  MoU should also mention that @) Joint Venture or association of the consultant is not intended for any partnarship of profit sharing and it is only for pulling up the resources together to  carry out the assignment   (i) Each party to the MoU is resparsible for their tax compliances: Parties to the contract to whom the payments to be made a5 per MoU should have their own PAN, which should be indicated in the MoU documents, Cont  ..2 NHAL New 17th on 26th
